summary: Noah is a significant figure in Abrahamic religions, including Judaism, Christianity, and Islam. According to the Bible, God instructed Noah to build an ark to save his family and various animals from a great flood. This story is known as the Genesis flood. After the flood, God promised never to destroy the earth again. Noah is also known for planting a vineyard and making wine. The story of Noah's ark has similarities to ancient Mesopotamian and Greek flood myths, suggesting influences from these earlier traditions.
title: Noah
